front.title: Symmetries in Images on Ancient Seals
front.abstract: The paper analyzes bilateral, rotational, antisymmetric and broken symmetries in images engraved on ancient stamp seals from Neolithic to pre-Columbian cultures. It examines how the geometric shape of seal bases (circular, elliptic, lentoid, rectangular) constrains image symmetry, and discusses examples from Mesopotamian, Egyptian, Indus Valley, Minoan, Mycenaean and pre-Columbian artifacts. The study proposes symmetry analysis as a methodological approach for archaeological interpretation of seal iconography.
